events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker explaining how kids were allowed to watch the first game until 8:30 before being sent away.  Another male speaker then is heard recounting how they were asked to clear the gym of cameras and people. Following this, he notes that he stopped the camera and sent the kids to bed. He then introduces that the camp was to end.  A basketball sound is then audible, as another male speaker says he was playing against Jordan, and afterwards, he and others would stay to play around 9:00 PM.  This speaker further describes how he was playing on Jordan's team, killing it with every shot. He references a specific game against OJ Mayo and Big Baby. Another male speaker mentions inviting college kids to the games or camp.  Another male speaker then says that they continued to play pick-up, and that "Mike was Mike." The clip continues with a different male speaker recounting how they would go back to playing, and then he starts his whole thing, saying things like "you can't guard me, you can't do this." Another male speaker is heard stating how he would jaw a little bit, and really get into him defensively.  A male speaker says they would get a good run-in for about an hour, hour 15.  Another speaker explains how he would back him down, saying "better scream for mama." A dribbling basketball noise is then audible, and a male speaker then recounts how he'd post him up and do everything.  He states how he hit his famous fadeaway on him, and that eventually, he said, "Okay, you got it going." At the end, a speaker mentions how he finally had to tell him, "look, dude."
